page.title: 11The Hall, Thornton
page.content: It was used as an officers' mess in World War Two when 1000 troops were stationed in the area.In 1978 it was bought by a company which sold the stables,outlying fields and converted the Hall to an Old People's home. There are 35 residents and 29 workers, some part-time. In the day residents shop, play bridge or watch television. Outings are organised fortnightly.One couple have been married 54 years.Mrs Dawson began work as a kitchen maid in 1915 at the age of 12.She and her husband ran a fish shop for 15 years, and she vividly recalls the flood in Thornton in 1931.As a child she had day trips to Scarborough and went to the Opera House-total cost l/6d.Until the 1940s there was a town-crier. Demand for housing has led to building taking place behind Low Mill Farm and over a pond.
